channel.title: Linux= Mac for free?
channel.description: Is Linux literraly Mac for free? They are both UNIX based and with a couple of tweaks you could have your Linux desktop looking like Mac couldnt you? But what my question is, does Linux operate at the same/a faster speed as/than OSX?

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Not at all, I don’t own a single Apple product.

Read full topic

Based on Unix in style maybe, but not in code

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Moparisthebest:

And if you want BSD, have a look at OpenBSD, it comes with a livecd and KDE installed by default, I like it.

I don’t see a livecd mentioned at openbsd.org.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you really want OSX (God knows why?) then get OSX. Linux can of course be made to look like and maybe even act somewhat like OSX, but really you should just go straight linux, if you put a little bit of time into it you will know how much better it is.

And if you want BSD, have a look at PC-BSD, it comes with a livecd and KDE installed by default, I like it.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Basing an OS on Unix/FreeBSD is actually a very smart idea in my opinion. Mopman, what else did they do, if you care to elaborate?

Read full topic

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:13, topic:154798”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=211443.msg1849811#msg1849811 date=1193546281]
That’s not “all they did” at all. They wrote the kernel, for a start (OK, it uses some code from BSD, but that’s what open source is all about)

EDIT: Actually, OK, they didn’t write it from ground up, but they developed it
[/quote]

No, all Apple wrote was the user interface. They tried writing a kernel once, and it sucked, so they stole the mach kernel and glued BSD onto it. Then they glued their UI and some other stuff on top of that, changed some folder names, renamed some utilities, and called it OS X.[/quote]

Which dates did you work at Apple for? From my understanding they did much more than that.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:154798”]That’s not “all they did” at all. They wrote the kernel, for a start (OK, it uses some code from BSD, but that’s what open source is all about)

EDIT: Actually, OK, they didn’t write it from ground up, but they developed it :p[/quote]

No, all Apple wrote was the user interface. They tried writing a kernel once, and it sucked, so they stole the mach kernel and glued BSD onto it. Then they glued their UI and some other stuff on top of that, changed some folder names, renamed some utilities, and called it OS X.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

Apple Mac is a form of BSD with a new DE and a few less compatibility things like linuxfs. If you want a clone try FreeBSD and play around a bit

Read full topic

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Mac’s are indeed Unix. They are slightly stripped down (You’ll notice there are a few less things in /usr/(s)bin) etc etc. All Apple did is create a simple structure in the /home/username/ directory for documents, music, desktop etc etc, then add in their own fancy desktop environment UI. You could easily get Ubuntu to look like a mac, I believe there are several Mac-Like themes for the Emerald theme manager. There is also Kiba-Dock, which I have yet to get working, but from the screenshots I’ve seen, it does pretty much the same thing as the dock standard on macs.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“killerman93, post:3, topic:154798”]Well im wandering, because my friend came round today with his OSX Leopard MacBook Pro, and id rather have one of them then then Vista. But what im short on is cash, and cant afford a MacBook Pro, and my parents wont get me one.
So I was thinking should I get Ubuntu looking like Mac OSX for free.[/quote]

OSX is more than just surface appearance. And a MacBook is $1k, which is half the price of a MBP.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux= Mac for free?
item.dc:creator: @killerman93 killerman93
item.description:
@killerman93 wrote:

xxlegitxx:

I’m pretty sure Linux is faster than OSX, though I could be wrong. Either way, I’m pretty sure they have enough differences to not be equated with each other. I’d rather use OSX than Linux anyday.

Well im wandering, because my friend came round today with his OSX Leopard MacBook Pro, and id rather have one of them then then Vista. But what im short on is cash, and cant afford a MacBook Pro, and my parents wont get me one.
So I was thinking should I get Ubuntu looking like Mac OSX for free.
